Detailed Description

Subclasses of CPResonder can be part of the responder chain.

Definition at line 42 of file CPResponder.j.

Member Function Documentation

- (BOOL) acceptsFirstResponder   [implementation]

Returns YES if the receiver is able to become the first responder. NO otherwise.

Definition at line 52 of file CPResponder.j.

00053 {
00054     return NO;
00055 }

- (BOOL) becomeFirstResponder   [implementation]

Notifies the receiver that it will become the first responder. The receiver can reject first responder if it returns NO. The default implementation always returns YES.

Returns:
YES if the receiver accepts first responder status.

Definition at line 62 of file CPResponder.j.

00063 {
00064     return YES;
00065 }

- (void) doCommandBySelector: (SEL)  aSelector   [implementation]

The receiver will attempt to perform the command, if it responds to it. If not, the -nextResponder will be called to do it.

Parameters:
aSelector the command to attempt

Definition at line 274 of file CPResponder.j.

00274                            :(SEL)aSelector
00275 {
00276     if ([self respondsToSelector:aSelector])
00277         [self performSelector:aSelector];
00278     else
00279         [_nextResponder doCommandBySelector:aSelector];
00280 }

Archives the responder to a coder.

Parameters:

Definition at line 356 of file CPResponder.j.

00356                        :(CPCoder)aCoder
00357 {
00358     // This will come out nil on the other side with decodeObjectForKey:
00359     if (_nextResponder !== nil)
00360         [aCoder encodeConditionalObject:_nextResponder forKey:CPResponderNextResponderKey];
00361 }

- (void) interpretKeyEvents: (CPArray)  events   [implementation]

Called to interpret a series of key events.

Parameters:
events an array of key CPEvents

Definition at line 98 of file CPResponder.j.

00098                           :(CPArray)events
00099 {
00100     var index = 0,
00101         count = [events count];
00102 
00103     for (; index < count; ++index)
00104     {
00105         var event = events[index];
00106 
00107         switch([event keyCode])
00108         {
00109             case CPLeftArrowKeyCode:    [self doCommandBySelector:@selector(moveLeft:)];
00110                                         break;
00111             case CPRightArrowKeyCode:   [self doCommandBySelector:@selector(moveRight:)];
00112                                         break;
00113             case CPUpArrowKeyCode:      [self doCommandBySelector:@selector(moveUp:)];
00114                                         break;
00115             case CPDownArrowKeyCode:    [self doCommandBySelector:@selector(moveDown:)];
00116                                         break;
00117             case CPDeleteKeyCode:       [self doCommandBySelector:@selector(deleteBackward:)];
00118                                         break;
00119             case CPReturnKeyCode:
00120             case 3:                     [self doCommandBySelector:@selector(insertLineBreak:)];
00121                                         break;
00122             
00123             case CPEscapeKeyCode:       [self doCommandBySelector:@selector(cancel:)];
00124                                         break;
00125 
00126             case CPTabKeyCode:          var shift = [event modifierFlags] & CPShiftKeyMask;
00127 
00128                                         if (!shift)
00129                                             [self doCommandBySelector:@selector(insertTab:)];
00130                                         else
00131                                             [self doCommandBySelector:@selector(insertBackTab:)];
00132 
00133                                         break;
00134 
00135             default:                    [self insertText:[event characters]];
00136         }
00137     }
00138 }

- (BOOL) resignFirstResponder   [implementation]

Notifies the receiver that it has been asked to give up first responder status.

Returns:
YES if the receiver is willing to give up first responder status.

- (BOOL) tryToPerform: (SEL)  aSelector
with: (id)  anObject 
[implementation]

The receiver will attempt to perform the command, or pass it on to the next responder if it doesn't respond to it.

Parameters:
aSelector the command to perform
anObject the argument to the method
Returns:
YES if the receiver was able to perform the command, or a responder down the chain was able to perform the command.

Definition at line 289 of file CPResponder.j.

00289                     :(SEL)aSelector with:(id)anObject
00290 {
00291     if([self respondsToSelector:aSelector])
00292     {
00293         [self performSelector:aSelector withObject:anObject];
00294         
00295         return YES;
00296     }
00297 
00298     return [_nextResponder tryToPerform:aSelector with:anObject];
00299 }
